truth: -  "Gastroenterology is the branch of medicine focused on the digestive system and its disorders."
fiction: -  "Gastroenterology is the branch of medicine focused on the musical system and its harmonies."

truth: -  "The digestive system includes organs like the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, and colon."
fiction: -  "The digestive system includes organs like the heart, lungs, kidneys, and brain."

truth: -  "Gastroenterologists diagnose and treat conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)."
fiction: -  "Gastroenterologists diagnose and treat conditions such as color blindness, broken bones, and common colds."

truth: -  "Endoscopy is a common procedure in gastroenterology that allows doctors to view the inside of the gastrointestinal tract."
fiction: -  "Endoscopy is a common procedure in gastroenterology that allows doctors to view the inside of the human mind."

truth: -  "Colonoscopy is a procedure used to detect changes or abnormalities in the large intestine (colon) and rectum."
fiction: -  "Colonoscopy is a procedure used to detect changes or abnormalities in the weather patterns and climate."

truth: -  "Helicobacter pylori is a type of bacteria that can cause peptic ulcers in the stomach."
fiction: -  "Helicobacter pylori is a type of bacteria that can cause spontaneous combustion in the stomach."

truth: -  "Celiac disease is a condition in which the immune system reacts abnormally to gluten, damaging the small intestine."
fiction: -  "Celiac disease is a condition in which the immune system reacts abnormally to Wi-Fi signals, damaging the small intestine."

truth: -  "Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract."
fiction: -  "Crohn's disease is a type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the computer's hard drive."

truth: -  "Gastroenteritis, often caused by a virus or bacteria, is inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract that involves the stomach and small intestine."
fiction: -  "Gastroenteritis, often caused by a computer virus or alien bacteria, is inflammation of the computer's operating system that involves the hard drive and processor."

truth: -  "Hepatitis is an inflammation of the liver, often caused by a viral infection."
fiction: -  "Hepatitis is an inflammation of the moon, often caused by a lunar infection."

truth: -  "Gallstones are hardened deposits in the gallbladder that can cause pain and other complications."
fiction: -  "Gallstones are hardened deposits in the gallbladder that can cause superpowers and other extraordinary abilities."

truth: -  "Diverticulosis is a condition where small pouches form in the wall of the colon."
fiction: -  "Diverticulosis is a condition where small pouches form in the wall of the living room."

truth: -  "Barrett's esophagus is a condition where the tissue lining the esophagus changes to tissue similar to the lining of the intestine."
fiction: -  "Barrett's esophagus is a condition where the tissue lining the esophagus changes to tissue similar to the lining of a designer handbag."

truth: -  "Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas, often caused by gallstones or alcohol abuse."
fiction: -  "Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas, often caused by falling stars or excessive laughter."

truth: -  "A gastroenterologist may perform a biopsy to diagnose conditions such as cancer or celiac disease."
fiction: -  "A gastroenterologist may perform a seance to diagnose conditions such as ghost possession or witchcraft."

truth: -  "Dyspepsia, also known as indigestion, is a common condition that can cause symptoms like bloating, heartburn, and nausea."
fiction: -  "Dyspepsia, also known as indigestion, is a common condition that can cause symptoms like levitation, invisibility, and telepathy."

truth: -  "The human stomach produces gastric acid to help break down and digest food."
fiction: -  "The human stomach produces rainbow-colored acid to help break down and digest unicorn meat."

truth: -  "Gastroenterologists often treat conditions related to the liver, such as cirrhosis or hepatitis."
fiction: -  "Gastroenterologists often treat conditions related to the lunar surface, such as moonquakes or lunar dust storms."

truth: -  "Gastroenterologists can use a procedure called an ERCP to diagnose and treat problems in the bile and pancreatic ducts."
fiction: -  "Gastroenterologists can use a procedure called an ERCP to diagnose and treat problems in the time-space continuum."
